step.context: \textbf{Check Point\#1: }\text{Is the following function}\\ \text{defined and continuous in }\left[0 , \dfrac{\pi}{2}\right]?
step.tex: \text{Yes.}\cos 2x \text{ is simply the sine function which is }\\ \text{defined and continuous for all x }
step.reason: \int_{a}^{b} f \left(x\right).dx \text{ makes sense only if }f \left(x\right) \text{ is defined}\\ \text{and continuous in }\left[0,\dfrac{\pi}{2}\right],\text{ for example}\int_{-\dfrac{\pi}{2}}^{\dfrac{\pi}{2}} \dfrac{dx}{\cos 2x} \\ \text{is not defined because }\dfrac{1}{\cos 2x}\text{ is discontinuous at}\\ x = 0. \in \left[-\dfrac{\pi}{2},\dfrac{\pi}{2}\right].
